title: NNVCD Pattern Identification Configuration
description: Configuration for identifying trends and anomalies in conflict events based on historical data

trend_continuity.definition: Event matches historical pattern in location and type
criteria: Event type matches >= 60% of historical events in LGA/State
Actors involved align with historical actor types
examples: Recurring farmer-herder clashes in Plateau State during planting season
Boko Haram-style attacks in Borno State

anomaly_escalation.definition: Event deviates significantly from historical patterns
criteria: Event type not represented in >= 80% of historical data for LGA/State
New actor type not previously active in area
Significant increase in fatality or scale compared to historical average
examples: First-time separatist violence in a previously unaffected LGA
Unusually high fatality count in a typically low-violence area

processing_steps.step_1: Retrieve historical event profile for specific LGA/State
processing_steps.step_2: Compare current event type, actors, and scale against historical profile
processing_steps.step_3: Assign Trend Continuity if within pattern thresholds
processing_steps.step_4: Assign Anomaly/Escalation if outside pattern thresholds
processing_steps.step_5: Generate pattern_id based on dominant historical trend or anomaly type
